page.title: 03LONGFORGAN - CARMICHAEL FARM
page.content: The farm extends to an area of 340 acres, comprised of 21 fields with an average acreage of 16 acres. Field boundaries are mostly tree-lined with Elm, Oak, Ash and Chestnut. Most of the Elms are presently being felled due to Dutch Elm Disease. The soil type is clay loam some of which is over a base of gravel. The soil depth is good and the farm is very fertile and is basically an arable fruit farm growing wheat,winter barley,oil seed rape,linseed,potatoes,swedes,vining peas and spring barley as arable crops and raspberries as a fruit crop. The farm is on a South facing slope on the Braes of the Carse rising from 250 ft. to 700 ft immediately to the South of Dron and North of Longforgan. The old steading built circa 1889 has mostly gone in favour of a modern concrete and asbestos shed,150'x80'&18" eaves.
